content.description: This enjoyable route starts in a short crack section with a high first bolt. There are a number of hard to read cruxes as you head up the slab.  An easy roof is passed before you reach the anchor.  Becareful lowering off, since the route is just at 100ft.
content.location: Second route from the left side of the crag.

content.description: reachy start leads to a left going slabby section followed by awesome steep juggy holds!
content.location: start at flat spot around the boulder to the right of bikini candy

content.description: This is a fun climb on good rock. Shares the start with the route to the left for 2 bolts and then pulls some big moves on steep rock with good holds. Move right slightly following some more bolts to a short crack(gear). Climb out of the crack and finish up to the bolted anchor.
content.protection: Small assortment of small to medium gear in addition to QDs for the bolts. 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: This is the farthest climb to the right on the Tahitian Wall. Shares the start with a route to the left(10b).

content.description:
Bora Bora is the leftmost established route on the Tahitian Rocks wall.  It is to the right and uphill from most of the other routes.  It starts in a gully which separtes the upper and lower portions of this rock.

Climb up ricey rock through 7 bolts to a set of chain anchors.  Several moves of 5.9 are found in the middle of the route.  The climbing is a little ricey, which detracts from the overall quality, but hopefully this will improve with time.  A one rope rap with a 60m gets you down.
content.protection: 7 bolts.  2-bolt chain anchor at the top.

content.description:
This is about as fun as a single pitch 5.8 sport route gets.

This climbs the lowest piece of Tahitian Rock left of a significant boulder laying against the rock.  The top accesses the gully that Bora Bora start in.

Climb the bolt line with a crux right off the ground.  After moving past the first bolt, this is wonderful steep 5.8 jug hauling.
